trans-unit.source: Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: You can manage your Microsoft Azure Service Fabric applications and services through Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can manage your Microsoft Azure Service Fabric applications and services through Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Managing your Service Fabric applications in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: You can manage your Microsoft Azure Service Fabric applications and services through Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can manage your Microsoft Azure Service Fabric applications and services through Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Once you've [setup your development environment](../service-fabric-setup-your-development-environment), you can use Visual Studio to create Service Fabric applications, add services, or package, register, and deploy applications in your local development cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once you've [setup your development environment](../service-fabric-setup-your-development-environment), you can use Visual Studio to create Service Fabric applications, add services, or package, register, and deploy applications in your local development cluster.

trans-unit.source: To manage your Service Fabric application, in the Solution Explorer right-click on your application project.
trans-unit.target: To manage your Service Fabric application, in the Solution Explorer right-click on your application project.

trans-unit.source: Manage your Service Fabric application by right-clicking on the Application project
trans-unit.target: Manage your Service Fabric application by right-clicking on the Application project

trans-unit.source: Deploying your Service Fabric application
trans-unit.target: Deploying your Service Fabric application

trans-unit.source: Deploying a Service Fabric application combines the following steps into one simple operation.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a Service Fabric application combines the following steps into one simple operation.

trans-unit.source: Creating the application package
trans-unit.target: Creating the application package

trans-unit.source: Uploading the application package to the image store
trans-unit.target: Uploading the application package to the image store

trans-unit.source: Registering the application type
trans-unit.target: Registering the application type

trans-unit.source: Removing any running application instances
trans-unit.target: Removing any running application instances

trans-unit.source: Creating a new application instance
trans-unit.target: Creating a new application instance

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, you can deploy an application by choosing Deploy Solution from the Build menu.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, you can deploy an application by choosing Deploy Solution from the Build menu.

trans-unit.source: Pressing **F5** will also deploy your application and attach the debugger to all application instances.
trans-unit.target: Pressing **F5** will also deploy your application and attach the debugger to all application instances.

trans-unit.source: Adding a service to your Service Fabric application
trans-unit.target: Adding a service to your Service Fabric application

trans-unit.source: You can add new Fabric Services to your application to extend its functionality.
trans-unit.target: You can add new Fabric Services to your application to extend its functionality.

trans-unit.source: To ensure the service is included in your application package, add the service through the **New Fabric Service...** menu item.
trans-unit.target: To ensure the service is included in your application package, add the service through the **New Fabric Service...** menu item.

trans-unit.source: Add a new Fabric Service to your application
trans-unit.target: Add a new Fabric Service to your application

trans-unit.source: Select a Service Fabric project type to add to your application, and specify a name for the service.
trans-unit.target: Select a Service Fabric project type to add to your application, and specify a name for the service.

trans-unit.source: See [choosing a framework for your service](service-fabric-choose-framework.md) to help decide which service type to use.
trans-unit.target: See [choosing a framework for your service](service-fabric-choose-framework.md) to help decide which service type to use.

trans-unit.source: Select a Fabric Service project type to add to your application
trans-unit.target: Select a Fabric Service project type to add to your application

trans-unit.source: The new service will be added to your solution and existing application package.
trans-unit.target: The new service will be added to your solution and existing application package.

trans-unit.source: The service references and a default service instance will be added to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: The service references and a default service instance will be added to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: The service will be created and started the next time you deploy the application.
trans-unit.target: The service will be created and started the next time you deploy the application.

trans-unit.source: The new service will be added to your application manifest
trans-unit.target: The new service will be added to your application manifest

trans-unit.source: Packaging your Service Fabric application
trans-unit.target: Packaging your Service Fabric application

trans-unit.source: An application package needs to be created in order to deploy the application and its services to a cluster.
trans-unit.target: An application package needs to be created in order to deploy the application and its services to a cluster.

trans-unit.source: The package organizes the application manifest, service manifest(s), and other necessary files in a specific layout.
trans-unit.target: The package organizes the application manifest, service manifest(s), and other necessary files in a specific layout.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio sets up and manages the package in the application project's folder, in the 'pkg' directory.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio sets up and manages the package in the application project's folder, in the 'pkg' directory.

trans-unit.source: Clicking **Package** creates or updates the application package.
trans-unit.target: Clicking **Package** creates or updates the application package.

trans-unit.source: You may want to do this if you deploy the application using custom Powershell scripts.
trans-unit.target: You may want to do this if you deploy the application using custom Powershell scripts.

trans-unit.source: Removing an application
trans-unit.target: Removing an application

trans-unit.source: You can remove an application from your local cluster using Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can remove an application from your local cluster using Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: This will revert the deployment steps described above:
trans-unit.target: This will revert the deployment steps described above:

trans-unit.source: Remove any running application instances
trans-unit.target: Remove any running application instances

trans-unit.source: Unregister the application type
trans-unit.target: Unregister the application type

trans-unit.source: Remove the application package from the image store
trans-unit.target: Remove the application package from the image store

trans-unit.source: Remove an application
trans-unit.target: Remove an application

trans-unit.target:
